intro: Pyramidium griffithianum, commonly known as the Griffith's pyramidium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display. However, it is relatively rare and requires specific conditions to thrive.
